byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Zoran Cirjakovic from Belgrade, Elian Peltier from Paris, Anne Barnard from Erbil, Iraq, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

abstract: Experts warn record-breaking migration of millions of people--fleeing war, poverty and persecution across globe--may increase and continue for years due to regional instability; there are currently some 60 million displaced people and refugees on Earth.
lead_paragraph: The most striking thing about the monumental migration crisis may not be the millions of people on the move now, but rather, the countless others who are poised to follow their paths to Europe.

headline.main: A Mass Migration Crisis, and It May Yet Get Worse
headline.print_headline: A Mass Migration Crisis, and It May Yet Get Worse

snippet: The most striking thing about the monumental migration crisis may not be the millions of people on the move now, but rather, the countless others who are poised to follow their paths to Europe.
